While AI boosts productivity, it threatens labor-intensive roles. India must prioritize reskilling and R&D. Rising household debt adds financial risk. Export sectors also face headwinds. Swift action is needed to adapt to the technology revolution and ensure workforce evolution.

Overall, domestic support is strong, with external factors posing a headwind.

Officials are closely monitoring employment trends while keeping inflation in focus.

items.summary: India's toll collection is set to more than double in the next two years, reaching ₹1,40,000 crore. This significant increase is driven by the government's ambitious plan to build world-class road infrastructure. Road transport minister Nitin Gadkari outlined a roadmap for safe, sustainable, and economically viable roads.

items.title: Major ports target complete switch to landlord model by 2047: Union Minister Sonowal
items.summary: India's major ports are set for a complete transformation by 2047. The government plans to shift all cargo handling to public-private partnerships. This move aims to boost efficiency and reduce turnaround times. Ports are also becoming green logistic hubs, developing green hydrogen capacity for production, bunkering, and exports. This initiative will create jobs and drive industrial growth across the nation.

items.title: Aluminium body seeks 15% import duty, tougher scrap norms
items.summary: The Aluminium Association of India is urging the government to increase import duties on aluminium products to 15 percent. They also want stricter quality checks on scrap imports. This move aims to protect the domestic market from becoming a dumping ground for global aluminium. India's aluminium imports are projected to rise significantly, potentially impacting local industry investments.

items.title: Investors take control of Bira 91's Beer Cafe amid cash crunch
items.summary: In a decisive move, Kirin Holdings, the principal stakeholder of Bira 91, along with its financial partner Anicut Capital, have taken charge of The Beer Cafe, a subsidiary of Bira 91. This takeover comes amidst the brewery's ongoing struggles with finances and declining sales figures.

items.title: Gstaad Hotels likely to raise ₹1,300 cr from sale of JW Marriott Bengaluru
items.summary: Gstaad Hotels is poised to generate ₹1,300 crore by offloading the JW Marriott Bengaluru, a notable event in the Indian hotel market. With more than 40 entities—ranging from corporate giants to private equity investors—expressing interest, this sale is part of Gstaad's efforts to navigate through bankruptcy.

items.title: Depositors can name up to four nominees from November 1
items.summary: New banking rules empower customers to nominate up to four people for their accounts, lockers, and safe deposit articles. These changes, effective November 1, offer greater flexibility. Depositors can now nominate minors, with an adult appointed to manage funds on their behalf. The framework replaces older rules, simplifying the nomination process for all bank customers.

items.title: Luxury housing in India gets an upgrade with designer clubhouses
items.summary: In the realm of luxury housing in India, builders are reimagining clubhouses as extravagant retreats. With innovative features such as atmospheric lighting, co-working spaces, and pampering pet facilities, these developments prioritize an elevated lifestyle for residents.

items.title: Trade talks with EU reduced ‘outstanding issues’, says Goyal
items.summary: Foundation laid for balanced and robust agreement, says Minister after meeting with counterpart; high-level EU team to visit India next week

items.title: Budget 2026: Ficci pushes for tax certainty, faster dispute resolution
items.summary: Corporate India is rallying for crucial reforms as the budget season approaches. Their wishlist highlights the necessity for minimized legal conflicts, clarified tax guidelines, and a more user-friendly compliance landscape. The influential FICCI has put forth its suggestions to the finance ministry, calling for swifter tax appeal processes and simplified rules surrounding share buybacks.

items.title: India plans cost roadmap to regain textile edge over Bangladesh, Vietnam, China
items.summary: India is developing a comprehensive cost roadmap for its textiles sector to regain global price competitiveness against rivals like Bangladesh, Vietnam, and China. This plan, spanning short, medium, and long terms, aims to lower production and export costs by addressing raw materials, logistics, energy, and taxation. The initiative also seeks to boost R&D and innovation to achieve ambitious export targets.

items.title: Bright spot: Manufacturing, festive push keep factory output steady at 4% in September
items.summary: India's industrial output showed steady growth in September. Manufacturing led the expansion, offsetting slower performance in mining and electricity. Demand was boosted by inventory stocking ahead of Goods and Services Tax cuts during the festive season. This positive trend is expected to continue in the coming months.

items.title: India-EU FTA talks productive, have narrowed gaps, says Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal stated that his recent talks with the EU have significantly reduced outstanding issues, paving the way for a robust and balanced Free Trade Agreement. Both sides expressed optimism following productive discussions, with further technical negotiations scheduled in New Delhi next week to expedite the conclusion of the FTA.

items.title: Bid deadline for 10th O&G licensing round extended again
items.summary: The government has extended the deadline for oil and gas exploration bids. The new submission date is December 31. This is to encourage more companies to participate. The Xth exploration licensing round under OALP has faced several extensions. The government aims to boost India's declining oil and gas output and reduce import dependence.

items.title: Big market shift: FPIs convert futures to cash shares
items.summary: Huge conversion of stock futures on expiry day by FPIs results in a bloated buy figure of over  ₹10,000 crore. &nbsp;

items.title: A quip that stings but also inspires
items.summary: Economics Laureate Joel Mokyr’s line, that ‘economic historians don’t win Nobel Prizes’, captures a professional unease

items.title: HAL, Russian planemaker to build passenger jets in India
items.summary: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited will produce Russian SJ-100 commercial jets in India. This collaboration aims to boost short-haul flight connectivity under the UDAN Scheme. HAL expects significant demand for these aircraft over the next decade. The company's order book is substantial, primarily for defense aircraft. This move marks HAL's re-entry into commercial jet manufacturing.

items.title: India's data centre capacity to double by 2027, may rise 5x by 2030: Macquarie Equity Research
items.summary: India's data centre capacity is set for significant growth. Projections indicate a doubling by 2027 and a potential fivefold increase by 2030. This expansion is driven by factors like data localisation laws and rising cloud adoption. Major investments are planned, including Google's AI infrastructure hub in Andhra Pradesh. This surge promises to bolster India's digital infrastructure.

items.title: US Fed Meeting: Date, time, when and where to watch Fed chair Jerome Powell’s speech
items.summary: US Fed Meeting: The US Federal Reserve is hosting its two-day policy meeting to discuss and announce the key benchmark interest rates for the US economy. Here's when and where to watch Fed chair Jerome Powell’s speech on Wednesday…

items.title: Technical glitch delays market opening at Multi-Commodity Exchange; probe initiated
items.summary: The outage impacted trading in key commodity contracts such as gold, silver, crude oil, and base metals like copper, zinc and aluminium

items.title: DGFT allows self-declaration of origin under India–EFTA trade pact
items.summary: This move simplifies procedures for Indian exporters seeking duty concessions while exporting to EFTA nations—Switzerland, Norway, Iceland, and Liechtenstein

items.title: LIC denies receiving or issuing documents cited in Washington Post report alleging external influence on investment decisions
items.summary: Life Insurance Corporation of India has denied allegations from The Washington Post. The insurer states it neither issued nor received documents suggesting external influence on its investments in the Adani Group. LIC maintains all investment decisions are made independently and with due diligence. This is the second denial from LIC regarding the report.

items.title: Orkla India raises ₹500 crore from anchors ahead of ₹1,667-crore IPO
items.summary: Shares were allotted at ₹730 apiece to major institutions such as Nippon India MF, LIC MF, Aditya Birla Sun Life MF, Nomura Funds Ireland, and Government Pension Fund Global.

items.title: Won’t absolutely discontinue Russian oil purchases as long as we are sanction compliant, says Indian Oil Executive
items.summary: Mr. Jain said Russian entities have been sanctioned and not the crude oil.

items.title: Will US Fed cut rates? Meeting in focus as government shutdown continues. Here's what to expect
items.summary: The US Federal Reserve is expected to a rate cut to support the cooling labour market, lowering the benchmark rate to 3.75-4.00 per cent amid the prolonged US government shutdown and lack of data. Here's what analysts expect…

items.title: Della Group inks pacts for integrated townships across 412 acres in four cities
items.summary: Della Group is launching five integrated townships across India. This marks their entry into an asset-light model, collaborating with landowners for development. The projects span 412 acres with a GDV of Rs 5,800 crore. Further alliances are in advanced talks for an additional Rs 14,000 crore portfolio. This strategy focuses on design and execution expertise.

items.title: Higher festival sales could be outcome of pent-up demand: Nomura
Sebi proposes major overhaul of mutual fund rules to cut investor costs
items.summary: Regulator plans to revamp TER structure, tighten brokerage limits, and expand AMC business scope while pushing for greater fee transparency.

items.title: India’s gold pile with RBI hits 880 tonnes; forex reserves ease to $700 bn
items.summary: The share of gold in total forex reserves climbed to 13.92 per cent

items.title: UPS Layoffs: 34,000 workers laid off in first 9 months of 2025 amid turnaround efforts
items.summary: The 34,000 eliminated jobs marked a 70 per cent increase from its previous target. UPS had in April said it was planning to lay off 20,000 of its employees as part of its turnaround plan.

items.title: Government committed to farmers' welfare: PM Modi on non-urea fertiliser subsidy hike for Rabi season
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the Cabinet's approval of nutrient-based subsidy rates for phosphatic and potassic fertilizers for the 2025-26 Rabi season. This decision, aimed at farmer welfare, includes increased subsidies for phosphorus and sulphur, ensuring affordable fertilizers and potentially boosting farmer incomes. Subsidy rates for nitrogen and potash remain unchanged.

items.title: Jindal Steel to have a CEO after five years as Gautam Malhotra is elevated
items.summary: Jindal Steel's net profit stood at  ₹638 crore in Q2, a decline of about 26% from a year earlier and a 58% drop sequentially. It was below analyst expectations.

items.title: India to set up National Aviation Safety Centre as skies grow busier
items.summary: The government plans to double DGCA and AAIB manpower, supported by the new Bharatiya Vayuyan Adhiniyam, 2024

items.title: ReNew Energy Global bags score of 83 in S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment
items.summary: It is the first time an India-based energy company has crossed the 80-point threshold in one of the world's most respected ESG benchmarks, ReNew said.

items.title: Govt eases Certificate of Origin for India-EFTA exports
items.summary: In a significant move to enhance trade efficiency, the DGFT has introduced a self-declaration method for domestic exporters to secure their Certificate of Origin under the India-EFTA free trade agreement.

items.title: DGCA may impose restrictions on power bank use onboard flights
items.summary: After a passenger's power bank ignited on an IndiGo flight, the DGCA, India's aviation regulator, is taking steps to revisit the rules governing power banks onboard. While the discussion leans towards imposing certain restrictions, a complete ban is not anticipated. The regulator is committed to examining international safety practices to bolster passenger protection and reduce risks during flights.

items.title: Trai, DoT concur on the view to display original name of caller by default
items.summary: Caller name display will now be enabled by default for all phone users. This move aims to curb fraud and cybercrime. The service will be available on 4G and newer technologies. Devices sold after a six-month period will feature this. The Department of Telecom will finalize the implementation details.

items.title: Office developers sniff a service opportunity in India's GCC boom
items.summary: As the GCC opportunity grows, developers are looking to provide real estate, operational support, talent acquisition, technology, and regulatory compliance support services to companies looking to set up such centres in India.

items.title: AIBOC to hold crucial 2-day high-level meetings in Guwahati
items.summary: These meetings will bring together top banking officer union leaders to deliberate on the organisation’s future trajectory and critical issues impacting its vast membership

items.title: Nvidia to invest $1 billion for 2.9% stake in Nokia amid push towards artificial intelligence — Here's what we know
items.summary: US-based big tech firm, Nvidia Corp., announced its plans to invest $1 billion in Nokia Oyj to acquire a 2.9% stake in the Finnish company amid the push towards advancement for artificial intelligence.&nbsp;

items.title: India, EU FTA talks: Outstanding issues reduced, EU team to visit next week
items.summary: India and the European Union are advancing free trade agreement negotiations. Key tariff issues are seeing good progress. An EU delegation will visit New Delhi soon to finalize technical tariff discussions. Both sides aim for a robust and balanced agreement. This pact is expected to bring the economies closer and foster mutual benefits.

items.title: Adani Green Q2 profit jumps 25% as it adds 2.4GW capacity in six months
items.summary: Adani Green Energy's operational capacity stands at 16.7GW as of 30 September, keeping it on track to achieve its target of 50GW of installed capacity by 2029-30.

items.title: Asia’s Unrivalled IB School: GIIS Sets the Gold Standard in Education
More service jobs needed for India to become prosperous: NITI Aayog
items.summary: The think tank’s report calls for a new policy approach to make services the central pillar of India's employment strategy, moving beyond its current output-intensive, yet less job-intensive, growth pattern.

items.title: Air India Express to strengthen domestic network
Karnataka Bank sees senior leadership exodus
items.summary: Spate of exits began June this year when former CEO Sarma and ED Rao faced a rift with the bank’s board

items.title: TVS continues to flag rare-earth magnet crisis, hopes GST reforms to boost H2 sales
items.summary: TVS Motor Co. Ltd reported a 30% quarter-on-quarter rise in net profit to  ₹833 crore, as revenue grew 15% sequentially to  ₹14,051 crore in the September quarter.

items.title: CESC arm bags 300 MW solar project from SECI at Rs 2.86 per kWh
items.summary: CESC's subsidiary Purvah Green Power has secured a significant Letter of Award from SECI. This award is for a 300 MW solar power project. The project will also feature an integrated energy storage system. This development marks a key step in renewable energy expansion. The project is set for 25 years. The tariff is fixed at Rs 2.86 per kWh.

items.title: SEBI proposes overhaul of mutual fund regulations to simplify rules and cut investor costs
items.summary: The market regulator seeks public comments by November 17 on a comprehensive rewrite of the 1996 framework governing mutual funds

items.title: Sundram Fasteners Q2 consolidated net up 6%
items.summary: Revenue from operations was up 2.3% to ₹1,521 crore

items.title: Microsoft stock jumps over 4% after tech giant reaches $500 billion valuation deal with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI
items.summary: Microsoft stock jumped more than 4% during the intraday Wall Street session on 28 October 2025, after the tech giant reached a $500 billion valuation deal with the artificial intelligence (AI) ChatGPT-maker OpenAI.

items.title: 2G users to miss out as caller ID to curb spam calls nears rollout
items.summary: The caller ID feature, which the DoT will notify, aims to help users identify unidentified callers, make an informed decision about whether to pick up, and reduce unwanted spam calls.

items.title: UGC names 22 fake universities, including 9 in Delhi; know how to verify your college’s authenticity
items.summary: The University Grants Commission has issued a stern warning to students. An institute in Delhi, the Institute of Management and Engineering, is operating without UGC recognition. It is offering degrees that are invalid under the UGC Act, 1956. Students enrolling in such unapproved programs risk receiving qualifications that will not be accepted by universities or employers.

items.title: Cyclone Montha, hurricane Melissa erupt in landfall, half a world apart
items.summary: Montha was buffeted by maximum sustained wind speeds of 90-100 km/hr gusting to 110 km/hr, IMD said

items.title: FICCI suggests changes in TDS norms, reducing pendency of appeals
items.summary: Currently, there are 37 different types of payments to residents where the TDS rates vary from 0.1% to 30%

items.title: Tata Capital Q2 PAT up 33% to ₹1,128 crore
items.summary: The newly listed NBFC’s net interest income (NII) rose 23% YoY to ₹2,637 crore, while fee income grew 59% YoY to ₹588 crore

items.title: Indus Towers sees upside from SC relief to Vi; eyes Africa foray in 6 months
items.summary: Indus Towers welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to reassess AGR dues, potentially easing Vodafone Idea's financial burden and improving sector prospects. Analysts believe this ruling could enhance Vodafone Idea's survival chances, which is crucial for Indus Towers' stability and valuation.

items.title: Apple hits $4 trillion market cap, joins Nvidia and Microsoft to reach milestone
items.summary: Apple reached the historic market capitalisation of $4 trillion, becoming the third public company to reach this milestone after Nvidia and Microsoft. This comes amid strong demand for the iPhone 17 series and new product launches this holiday season.

items.title: DGCA approves empanelment of 10 new aeromedical evaluation centres
items.summary: The aviation sector in India just got a considerable boost as the DGCA introduces ten new aeromedical evaluation centres. This innovative move is designed to expedite medical evaluations for pilots and other licensing professionals, fulfilling a vital need within the industry.

items.title: Cholamandalam MS General Insurance reports marginal rise in GWP
items.summary: The GWP for the half year ended September 2025 (H1FY26) was just marginally up to ₹4217 cr compared to ₹4136 cr in the year-ago period

items.title: Saudi LCC flyadeal to enter India next year with 4-5 destinations
items.summary: The network expansion comes at a time Saudi Arabia has unveiled Saudia 2030 Vision, an ambitious plan to diversify its economy beyond oil and create expanded opportunities for its citizens and position the country as a tourist hub

items.title: Aviation watchdog DGCA flags lapses at Akasa Air;airline says it submits comprehensive responses
items.summary: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has identified several compliance issues at Akasa Air. These include repeated procedural errors and documentation gaps. The DGCA reviewed surveillance data from April to September. Akasa Air stated it always provides timely responses to observations. The airline remains committed to safety and regulatory adherence.

items.title: Ousted Mehli Mistry may move Court, but needs to prove procedural lapses
items.summary: Mistry however has the tough task to prove that the decision to vote him out was procedurally flawed, arbitrary or contrary to the Trust’s governing documents, said legal experts

items.title: Flight operations at Thiruvananthapuram airport to be halted for five hours on October 30
items.summary: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport will halt flight services for five hours on October 30, from 4:45 pm to 9:00 pm. This temporary suspension is to accommodate the 'Alpassi Arattu' procession of the Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, which traditionally crosses the airport runway. The airport has observed this centuries-old ritual for decades, with operations suspended twice annually for the temple's biannual festivals.

items.title: Jio tops race with 50 crore total subscribers, BSNL outpaces Airtel; Vi loses 7 lakh users: TRAI report
items.summary: In September 2025, BSNL led in mobile subscriber additions with 5.24 lakh, while Airtel added 4.37 lakh. Reliance Jio's broadband subscribers surpassed 50 crore, contributing to a total telecom base of 122.89 crore, with significant losses reported by Vodafone Idea and others.

items.title: RBI brings home 64 tonnes of gold between March 2025 and Sept 2025
items.summary: India’s central bank has brought home 274 tonnes of gold since March 2023. The move to accelerated repatriation of gold started post the Russia- Ukraine war and the Taliban’s takeover of Afghanistan.

items.title: India in talks with China on additional end-user conditions for rare earth imports
items.summary: Indian Embassy in Beijing discussing with the Chinese Commerce Ministry how Indian importers can meet criteria of guaranteeing no re-exports

items.title: Thyssenkrupp's steel head Dennis Grimm resigns amid sale talks with Jindal Steel
items.summary: Dennis Grimm, the leader of Thyssenkrupp's steel division, is departing. This happens as Thyssenkrupp deepens talks to sell the steel business to India's Jindal Steel International. A delegation from Jindal is set to conduct further due diligence this week. Grimm's exit follows a disagreement with Thyssenkrupp CEO Miguel Lopez over the business's strategic direction.

items.title: Advent International's arm exits India's Aditya Birla Capital, exchange data shows
items.summary: Advent International's affiliate Jomei Investments has divested its entire 2% equity stake in Aditya Birla Capital for approximately $186.47 million. The sale of 53.2 million shares occurred at a slight discount to the previous day's closing price. This follows a previous sale of a 1.4% stake by Advent International in June.

items.title: Jindal Steel appoints Gautam Malhotra as CEO
items.summary: Jindal Steel has announced Gautam Malhotra as its new Chief Executive Officer, a role he will officially step into on October 28, 2025, as decided by the board. Since May 2024, Malhotra has been a vital part of Jindal Steel, and with his robust background across multiple sectors, he will orchestrate the company's strategic objectives and enhance its operational efficiency.

items.title: DMRC set to foray into port sector by developing automated cargo evacuation system in Gujarat
items.summary: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) is making bold strides into the maritime domain with a groundbreaking agreement to develop a cutting-edge automated cargo evacuation system at Kandla port. This initiative aims to harness innovative technologies for enhanced operational efficiency, with DMRC overseeing its operations for the next quarter-century.

items.title: Enough crude oil available globally, says Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri
items.summary: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri stated that India has adequate crude oil supply and alternative sources are available if one stream is disrupted. He highlighted India's growing refining capacity and its increasing role in global energy demand, projecting a rise in crude consumption to six million barrels per day.

items.title: Signature Global secures  ₹8.75 billion via NCDs for sustainable housing projects
items.summary: In the fiscal year 2024-25, Signature Global ranked as the fifth-largest listed real estate developer based on sales bookings, achieving pre-sales of  ₹102.9 billion. The company is targeting  ₹125 billion in the current financial year.

items.title: WazirX trading volumes jumped by ₹40-50 cr in Phase 4 of restructuring: Nischal Shetty Founder of WazirX
items.summary: ‘WazirX now trying to make the most of the user enthusiasm by focusing on recovering trust’

items.title: Oil minister allays fears over Russian crude oil supply
MSC flags concerns at Vizhinjam port: Crew unable to come ashore, manual documentation
items.summary: Global shipping major MSC highlights issues at Kerala's Vizhinjam Port.  The company has transshipped over 1.1 million TEUs using manual systems due to the absence of ICEGATE.  Crew members cannot disembark due to a lack of immigration facilities.  Standardized documentation across Indian ports is also needed.  MSC sees significant opportunities in India's maritime sector.

items.title: DGCA expands pilot medical evaluation network with 10 new centres
items.summary: The new centres, the DGCA said, have been strategically located to ensure nationwide coverage and faster turnaround times for medical assessments

items.title: PNB Housing Finance says regulatory process underway for new MD & CEO; Jatul Anand to lead interim
items.summary: Girish Kousgi has formally exited as PNB Housing Finance's MD & CEO, with his tenure concluding on October 28, 2025. Executive Director Jatul Anand will serve as interim head while the company seeks regulatory approval for a new full-time leader. Kousgi had resigned in July citing personal reasons and a desire to pursue external opportunities.

items.title: Gold slips below Rs 1.2 lakh per 10 gm, may boost wedding demand
items.summary: Gold prices have dropped below Rs 1.2 lakh per 10 gm. This decline is expected to significantly boost sales during the upcoming wedding season. Jewellers are restocking gold to meet anticipated demand. The price correction offers increased affordability for consumers. Market watchers are now focused on US-China trade talks and the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision for further market direction.

items.title: This could be the best festival season sales ever:  FADA
items.summary: As down payments and EMIs on vehicles reduced, consumers have increased vehicle purchases during this festival season

items.title: Cyclone Montha hits rail network: 122 trains cancelled, dozens rescheduled as South Central Railway braces for impact
items.summary: Cyclone Montha caused significant disruptions to train services across the South Central Railway zone. Over 160 trains were affected, with 122 cancelled. Services between Visakhapatnam and Vijayawada faced the most cancellations. Long-distance trains connecting southern metros to eastern and northeastern regions were also impacted. Railways implemented precautionary measures for passenger safety.

items.title: NCLAT rejects Glas Trust’s plea opposing Aakash's EGM
items.summary: Glas Trust alleged the proposed rights issue would reduce the shareholding of Byju’s parent, Think &amp; Learn, from around 25% to 5%, significantly diluting its value in the test-prep firm.

items.title: We are looking for durable relations with India: Dutch minister Robert Tieman
items.summary: Along with green and digital shipping the Netherlands is also keen to offer its shipbuilding expertise to India

items.title: India’s forex reserves up $31.76 billion in H1FY26
items.summary: The RBI held 880.18 metric tonnes of gold as on September 2025, of which, 575.82 metric tonnes were held domestically

items.title: Amazon to cut 14,000 corporate jobs globally; ‘in India, a few thousand roles’
items.summary: The Seattle-based e-tailer has 1.2 lakh to 1.3 lakh direct employees in India of which some 35,000 are in corporate roles, as per industry sources

items.title: Autumn orchard fires choke Kashmir; experts call for sustainable alternatives
items.summary: Temperature inversion — a weather phenomenon where a layer of warm air traps cooler air near the ground — prevents pollutants from dispersing, further deteriorating air quality

items.title: Canara HSBC Life will not have to take extreme steps for adjusting distribution commissions: MD & CEO
items.summary: Says the insurer’s commission rates are already on the lower end

items.title: Infosys buyback: What past offers reveal about investor sentiment and future stock direction
items.summary: Infosys announces an  ₹18,000 crore buyback, its largest ever, amid a 25% stock decline. Historically, shares reacted negatively initially but recovered post-buyback. The program includes 10 crore shares at  ₹1800 each, with 15% reserved for small investors.

items.title: Leather seats, USB ports and sky lighting: Inside Air India Express' sleek Boeing 737-8 cabin upgrade
items.summary: Air India Express has unveiled its retrofitted Boeing 737-8, featuring enhanced passenger comfort with new seats, improved legroom, and USB charging. This modernization is part of the airline's brand transformation under the Tata Group, aiming to offer a premium experience on its expanding network of 500 daily flights connecting 60 destinations.

items.title: Microsoft to now hold $135 billion stake in OpenAI as ChatGPT maker completes restructure
items.summary: Microsoft will now have 27% ownership of OpenAI as the ChatGPT has completed its restructure to a public benefit corporation.

items.title: Call to promote black pepper cultivation globally to boost consumption
items.summary: Sangeetha Viswanathan, chairperson of the Spices Board, emphasised India’s pivotal role in shaping the global spice trade and driving inclusive growth in the pepper sector

items.title: US Stock Market today: Dow, Nasdaq, S&P 500 hit record high as Federal Reserve starts its policy meeting — Check details
items.summary: US Stock Market today: Benchmark indices like the Dow Jones, Nasdaq, and S&amp;P 500 hit their record high levels on Tuesday, 28 October 2025, as the US Federal Reserve begins its two-day policy meeting.&nbsp;

items.title: PM to address maritime leaders conclave, chair Global Maritime CEO Forum at IMW2025 in Mumbai
items.summary: Participation of over 85 countries, with more than 1,00,000 delegates, 350+ international speakers in India Maritime Week 2025

items.title: Infibeam Avenues receives in-principle approval to operate as payment service provider at GIFT-IFSC
items.summary: Upon obtaining final authorization and meeting statutory requirements, Infibeam Avenues Fintech will be permitted to provide escrow services, enable cross-border remittances, and facilitate merchant payment processing and settlement.

items.title: UnitedHealth Group's shares up over 4% amid higher 2025 profit forecast, aims for growth in 2026
items.summary: UnitedHealth expects growth in 2026 as CEO Stephen Hemsley steers the company to recovery. Medical costs remain high, but in line with company expectations, while quarterly revenue at its Optum health services unit was flat.

items.title: Indian aviation industry to incur net losses up to Rs 105 billion in FY26: ICRA
items.summary: Indian airlines face growing financial losses projected to reach Rs 95-105 billion in FY2026. This increase stems from slower passenger traffic growth and higher operational expenses. Aviation Turbine Fuel costs remain a significant factor. Despite challenges, international travel shows stronger recovery. The sector navigates operational and financial headwinds impacting capacity and liquidity.

items.title: Jio powers digital Punjab with over 1 million premises connected through JioFiber & JioAirFiber
items.summary: Reliance Jio has connected over one million homes and businesses in Punjab with high-speed broadband and entertainment services.  JioAirFiber has gained 6 lakh subscribers, and JioFiber has connected 4.40 lakh premises.  Jio True 5G is now available across all districts, tehsils, and villages.  This expansion enhances Punjab's digital infrastructure, benefiting education, healthcare, agriculture, and entertainment, especially in rural areas.

items.title: American spices body seeks tariff relief as US-India trade talks gain momentum
items.summary: Entire US industry such as food, culinary, pharmaceuticals, alcohol and even auto parts are suffering because of tariffs, says Laura Shumow, Executive Director, ASTA

items.title: India poised to become second-largest oil refiner by 2035: Hardeep Singh Puri
items.summary: The refining and petroleum sector contributes about 20% of the country’s total revenue, underscoring its centrality to the economic framework

items.title: Adani Total Gas Q2 profit declines 12%
items.summary: Revenue from operations rose on account of higher volume and sales realisation

items.title: Swan Defence rebuilds Pipavav Shipyard at $250 million; ready for large vessel construction
items.summary: The company is home to India’s largest dry dock (662m x 65m) with a capacity of 400,000 Dead Weight Tonne and an annual steel fabrication capacity of 144,000 tonnes

items.title: Thermo Fisher Scientific invests ₹160 cr to expand Bengaluru R&D centre
items.summary: The Bengaluru facility has developed more than 2,000 high-quality recombinant antibodies that have contributed to advancements in infectious diseases, antiviral studies, and cancer biology

items.summary: IA Fintech is set to deliver a broad suite of digital payment and cross-border financial services

items.summary: The airline will receive 20-24 Boeing 737 Max aircraft in CY 2026

items.title: AGR relief to open up cash flows for Vodafone Idea, say analysts
items.summary: Some hinted that spectrum debts would be the next target for the company as they pose a bigger challenge

items.title: Army inks deal to procure 1st indigenously designed Software Defined Radios for secured communication
items.summary: SDRs are  developed by the Defense Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) and produced by Bharat Electronics Ltd Limited (BEL)

items.title: Veranda Learning Solutions profit grows, boosted by vocational segment sale
items.summary: The increase in PAT in the September quarter was supported by a non-cash gain of ₹133.3 crore from the sale of the company’s vocational segment

items.title: Tata Advanced Systems, Safran set up rotating parts manufacturing facility for the LEAP engine
items.summary: The facility will produce complex rotating parts for the CFM LEAP engine, including cutting-edge machining and special processes under one roof

items.title: From Amazon to Microsoft, tech layoffs to affect over 80,000 amid AI-led restructuring
items.summary: Amazon is joining the ranks of big tech that have, in recent months, shaved staffing strength as increased investment in AI reshapes the industry. Overall, at least 81,416 jobs have been directly impacted due to AI-led restructuring.
